chess

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles the main logic of the chess game.
    Author:
    Akashkumar Patel, Umang Patel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game()
      Initializes game object to default values of having a White player and a Black player with all standard pieces in their default locations on a new chessboard.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean hasMoves(Player player, Board chessboard)
      Determines if the player has any moves possible that result in the player not being in check.
      boolean isInCheck(Player player, Board chessboard)
      Determines whether or not the given player is in check on the given board.
      void play()
      Core game loop that reads input and tracks the state of the game.
      int playTurn(java.lang.String move)
      Validates a move and processes the turn, modifying the board as necessary.
      void switchPlayers()
      Simple helper method to switch who is the current player.
      static int translate(java.lang.String coordinates)
      Translates a string representing the file and rank of a tile on the board into an integer representation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()
        Initializes game object to default values of having a White player and a Black player with all standard pieces in their default locations on a new chessboard.

    • Method Detail

      • play

        public void play()
        Core game loop that reads input and tracks the state of the game.

      • playTurn

        public int playTurn(java.lang.String move)
        Validates a move and processes the turn, modifying the board as necessary.
        Parameters:
        move - The input string representing the spaces to move to/from.
        Returns:
        The status of the move: returns a value representing whether the move was valid, invalid, or resulted in either checkmate or stalemate.

      • isInCheck

        public boolean isInCheck(Player player,
                         Board chessboard)
        Determines whether or not the given player is in check on the given board.
        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        chessboard - The chessboard.
        Returns:
        true if the player is in check, false otherwise.

      • hasMoves

        public boolean hasMoves(Player player,
                        Board chessboard)
        Determines if the player has any moves possible that result in the player not being in check.
        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        chessboard - The chessboard.
        Returns:
        true if the player has valid moves available, false otherwise.

      • switchPlayers

        public void switchPlayers()
        Simple helper method to switch who is the current player.

      • translate

        public static int translate(java.lang.String coordinates)
        Translates a string representing the file and rank of a tile on the board into an integer representation.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - The string form of the tile.
        Returns:
        The integer representing the tile on the board.
